Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1163711: Opening a PDF File by script, printing it, and closing it
ul_138933: Concatenate in a PDF the first page of several odt files alphabetically
so_51168569: Removing last page of PDF using Python or Bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_51168569: #!/bin/bash

for file in *.pdf
do
    page_nb=$(pdfinfo $file | awk '/^Pages/ { print $2 }')

    file_name=$(echo $file | cut -d'.' -f 1)

    gs -sDEVICE=pdfwrite -dNOPAUSE -dQUIET -dBATCH -dFirstPage=1 -dLastPage=$(expr $page_nb - 1) -sOutputFile=$file_name"_without_last_page.pdf" $file
done

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_48346354: Unzip to pipe and then run PDF info on the files in the stream
Top-3 Scripts:
so_48346354: $ unzip -l aaa.zip 
Archive:  aaa.zip
  Length      Date    Time    Name
---------  ---------- -----   ----
    19318  2018-02-19 22:49   zlib 3.pdf
   442780  2018-02-28 15:32   file2.pdf
      757  2018-02-28 15:22   try.sh
---------                     -------
   462855                     3 files

$ unzip -p aaa.zip file2.pdf | pdfinfo - | grep Pages
Pages:          94

$ unzip -p aaa.zip "zlib 3.pdf" | pdfinfo - | grep Pages
Pages:          2

for zip in *.zip ; do 
    zipinfo -1 "$zip" | grep 'pdf$'| while read pdf
    do
        unzip  -p "$zip" "$pdf" | pdfinfo - | grep Pages | sed -e "s/Pages:\s*//g"
    done  
done | awk '{ sum += $1;} END { print sum; }'

Explanations about Options.-p:
extract files to pipe (stdout). Nothing but the file data is sent to stdout , and
 the files are always extracted in binary format, just as they are stored (no
 conversions).
